sense.name: portion of an astronomical year, with days longer than nights
sense.examples: It was a long hot summer. This lily blooms in late summer. Johnny will go to summer school this year. They spend their summers on Cape Cod.

sense.name: a zenith of maturing powers
sense.commentary: SUMMER[+state][+maturity][+emerging] Note: is a figurative use of sense 1
sense.examples: The dissident had spent the summer of his life in prison. They were rosy-cheeked lads, in the summer of their youth.

sense.name: synonym for a year
sense.commentary: SUMMER[+time][+period][+year] Note: used as a count of years.
sense.examples: She was a girl of seventeen summers when he met her. Fifty summers ago today the dam broke and flooded our town.
